ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Do you make careless mistakes when working on a boring or difficult project?
Do you have difficulty keeping your attention when you are doing boring or repetitive work?
Do you have difficulty concentrating on what people say to you, even when they are speaking to you directly?
Do you have trouble wrapping up the final details of a project, once the challenging parts have been done?
Do you have difficulty getting things in order when you have to do a task that requires organization?
Do you avoid or delay getting started on a task?
Do you misplace or have difficulty finding things at home or at work?
Do you find yourself being distracted by activity or noise around you?
Do you have problems remembering appointments or obligations?
Do you fidget or squirm with your hands and feet when you have to sit down for a long time?
Do you leave your seat in meetings or other situations in which you are expected to remain seated?
Do you feel restless or fidgety?
Do you have difficulty unwinding and relaxing when you have time to yourself?
Do you feel overly active and compelled to do things, like you are (were) driven by a motor?
Do you find yourself talking too much when you are in social situations?
When you're in a conversation, do you find yourself finishing the sentences of the people that you are talking to, before they can finish them themselves?
Do you have difficulty waiting your turn in situations when turn-taking is required?
Do you interrupt others when they are busy?
AISRS number of inattention symptoms
Notes: Number of inattentive symptoms coded as ''moderate'' or ''severe''

ElementDescription: AISRS number of hyperactive/impulsive symptoms
Notes: Number of hyperactive-impulsive symptoms coded as ''moderate'' or ''severe''

ElementDescription: AISRS total number of symptoms
Notes: Total number of symptoms coded as ''moderate'' or ''severe''

ElementDescription: AISRS total severity of inattention symptoms
Notes: Sum responses for inattention symptoms to obtain severity

ElementDescription: AISRS total severity of hyperactive-impulsive symptoms
Notes: Sum responses for hyperactive-impulsive symptoms to obtain severity

ElementDescription: AISRS total symptom severity
Notes: Sum responses for all symptoms to obtain severity

ElementDescription: ADHD diagnosis
Notes: No diagnosis, ADHD-Combined, ADHD-inattentive, ADHD-hyperactive/impulsive, ADHD-Unspecified; other specified ADHD

ElementDescription: Timepoint/visit label
